content.description:
Although it is short, it is classic for the bouldery route genre.  Excellent movement and rock quality.

The route can finish either direct up the slab or bust out right to the arete.  Both finishes are excellent, with the slab probably being slightly harder.

Expect strenuous clips and non stop bouldering.  It feels more V6 than .12d.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Can be easily TR'd by walking up the backside.  Leading it adds a grade of difficulty.
content.location: The short route that ascends the clean face on the large boulder on the West side of the road.

content.description: Blocky climbing leads to a devious fingercrack on a less than vertical wall.
content.location: On the cliffs above the roadside boulders.

content.description: Right before the turn off for the China Wall, there is a huge slabby boulder sitting down off the righthand side of the trail.  This is the infamous Iceberg.  Rappel or hike down to the base.  The climb starts with a tricky cross and reach to the lip.  At this point you are faced with a most heinous mantle.  If you manage to gain the slab, cruise up sinker pockets to the anchor.

Located up the talus hill behind Rapid Fire, this short roof to slab problem is basically a nice 5.7 ruined by a .12a move.  The steep start has a long move off of a loose feeling backhand hold to crimps.  After this a 5.7 mantle to an easy slab.  The definition of a one-move wonder.
